title: Police issue all clear after UMass Boston reports ‘public safety threat’
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Police declared no ongoing threat at UMass Boston after a public safety alert was issued on Thursday afternoon.
The incident was centered around Residence Hall East Building; no shots fired and no firearms confirmed on campus.
Boston police and EMS responded to the report, prompting the cancellation of evening classes and activities.

title: ‘I would join a boycott’: Why readers oppose Market Basket’s firing of Artie T.
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Market Basket board of directors fired CEO Arthur T. Demoulas amid ongoing tensions and legal disputes.
Over 2,500 Boston.com readers overwhelmingly oppose Demoulas's firing, with 61% planning to boycott Market Basket.
Critics cite Demoulas's lack of cooperation with the board, while supporters highlight his employee-focused leadership.

title: Boston City Council shows mixed support for rent control ballot question
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Boston City Council debated a resolution to support a 2026 rent control ballot question, but a vote was blocked.
The proposed measure would cap rent increases tied to cost of living, with a maximum annual increase of 5%.
Councilors remain divided over rent control; a future committee hearing will gather more insight into the proposal.

title: Haim praises Brick Street Bagels: ‘Bomb bagels’
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Haim praised Brick Street Bagels in a recent interview, calling them 'bomb bagels' and unforgettable.
Brick Street Bagels, founded by Jordan Renouf in 2022, is opening a permanent location in South Boston this year.
Known for fresh, crunchy bagels, Brick Street also runs pop-ups and was named a favorite by Boston.com readers in 2024.

title: Thieves in Quincy are ordering pizzas then stealing the driver’s car, police say
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Two pizza delivery cars were stolen in Quincy in similar incidents, police reported.
The thefts involved masked individuals ordering pizza and stealing cars while drivers were distracted.
Stolen cars, a 2021 Durango and a 2015 Subaru, were later recovered in neighboring areas.

title: Man allegedly made bomb threats to Everett city councilor
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Scott Merchant, 36, from Salisbury, pleaded not guilty to making bomb threats against an Everett city councilor.
The FBI alerted Salisbury police to social media threats involving firearms and explosives against the councilor.
Merchant is charged with bomb/hijack threat and will reappear in court Thursday for a bail hearing.

title: Here’s why there are American flags above gates B32 and C19 at Boston Logan Airport
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: American flags at Logan Airport's gates B32 and C19 commemorate the Sept. 11 hijacked flights from Boston.
Flags were raised by airline employees shortly after 9/11 as a tribute without any official ceremony.
Four flags now fly at Logan, extending to gates B11 and B27, symbolizing resilience and remembrance.

title: MassINC poll: Just over half of voters approve of Healey’s performance
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: 56% of Massachusetts residents approve of Governor Maura Healey’s performance, according to a MassINC poll.
Healey's approval is strongest among Democrats, college-educated voters, and women over 50, but lowest among non-college grads.
Compared, Donald Trump has a higher disapproval rating, with 48% strongly disapproving of his performance in Massachusetts.

title: Where to find college student discounts in Greater Boston
author: Frances Klemm, Nia Harmon and Laura Emde
bullets: Boston businesses offer college students discounts with a valid student ID at performances, museums, and sports games.
Notable discounts include $30 theater tickets at American Repertory Theater and $10 rush tickets at ArtsEmerson.
Free museum admission is available at the Institute of Contemporary Art and Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum for certain students.

title: ‘It’s a cornerstone of who we are’: Read Rep. Lori Trahan’s letter to Market Basket board
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Rep. Lori Trahan expressed disappointment over Arthur T. Demoulas's firing as CEO of Market Basket.
Trahan's letter emphasized the significance of Market Basket to local communities and her personal connection to the store.
Demoulas's removal followed a feud with his sisters and efforts to prevent a 'work stoppage' akin to 2014 events.
